Timothy Wall wrote:

 > I am
> intimately familiar with the code, but I still don't keep *everything*
> in my head and when it comes to tracking complex interdependencies, the
> computer does (or should do) it much better than I can.  That's why
> we've got compilers, yes?

A compiler doesn't know that I have a runtime dependency that is not 
also a compile-time dependency. Example: method invocation via reflection.
